text: this year's America's Cup vessels are
more flying machine than yacht able to
hydrofoil over San Francisco Bay at
speeds approaching 50 miles an hour the
sail on the AC 72 s are 13 stories high
designed like an aeroplane wing
creating less drag and more thrust than
traditional soft sails and like an
airplane the wing has flaps which can be
adjusted to optimize the wings shape the
slot between the main element and the
flaps creates an airflow that allows
more power in light winds and slow
speeds especially when coming out of
turns the dagger boards are retractable
keels that descend from each of the
catamarans hulls the horizontal portion
the foil lifts the hull out of the water
greatly reducing drag and increasing
speeds the vertical portion helps offset
the winds tendency to push the boat
sideways
the elevators are small wings attached
to the rudders that help control how
much the yacht can lean forward or
backward the angle of the elevators
cannot be adjusted during the race so
they're set to provide the most ability
on the fast downwind sections
you
